topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5561b31563687232a8d70b00#post_5561b31563687232a8d70b00
[bq="trashboat"]Now that I look back at it. American cartoons from the 70s really were total garbage for the most part. (That time when scooby clones were everywhere)

70s Anime completely outclassed most of what we got.

Now I'm not saying that anime in general is better than american shows.

But for that decade, We got Scooby doo knockoffs, Super friends, And a lot of half assed looking celebrity cartoons.

And they had stuff like Gatchaman, Casshan, Yatterman, Mazinger Z, Getter robo, Raideen, Captain Harlock, Galaxy express 999, Space battleship Yamato, The robot romance trilogy, Aim for the ace, Doraemon, Lupin the third, And of course Mobile suit gundam.[/bq]
Don't know why I'm quoting this post.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:

do the scooby doo knock offs really count as knock offs if they were all made by hannah barbera? because _a shit ton of them were made by hannah barbera_
but yeah, aren't the 60's and 70's referred to as the dark ages of american animation or something along those lines?

The reason for that was the cost of animation made only one company capable of really turning out profitable cartoons and that company was Hanna-Barbara, who cloned their own shows, almost all those Scooby Doo knockoffs were made by them, because hey Scooby was popular,
